issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
As seen in [HMS API test|https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/standalone-metastore/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/client/TestDatabases.java#L452]Â dropping database (even with cascade) is failing when an index exists in the corresponding database, throwing MetaException:

Dropping the index firstÂ and then the DB resolves the issue, but that extra step shouldn't be required..
fields.summary: DropDatabase cascade fails when there is an index in the DB

comments.body:
So it turns out that this issue was only seen in our API tests. That's because when index tables were created for the test cases their "type" fields were not set as {{TableType.INDEX_TABLE}}. This is something Hive already does on HS2 side.

I think if we are to use HMS in standalone mode, API should make sure that we cannot create indexesÂ if the user specifies a non index-typed table.
I propose we throw an exception instead (see [^HIVE-18604.0.patch]). The rest of the changes in my patch are related testÂ fixes.

Â 

[~pvary], [~kuczoram] pls let me know what you think.
